In this exercise, we will calculate how large the balloon payment will be on 
 a loan to purchase a new house which cost $235,000.

In solving the problem, we will consider the following details:

| Particulars       |          |
|-------------------|----------|
| Rate              | 5.35%    |
| Period (months)   | 360      |
| Constant payment  | $925     |
| Cost of the house | $235,000 |

First, identify the present value of the annuity considering the monthly payment, rate, and monthly loan period.

To determine the present value of the loan, we will use the present value of an annuity formula. The formula of the annuity present value is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Present Value of an Annuity} &=C\times\dfrac{1-\dfrac{1}{\left(1+r\right)^t}}{r}
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$C$, which represent the cash amount or the constant payment\
$r$, which refers to the rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period.

Let's now calculate the balloon payment.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Balloon Payment} &= \$235,000-\$165,647.80
\\[5pt]
&= {\$69,352.20}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, based on our calculation the balloon payment is $69,352.20.

Finally, since the balloon payment is to be paid at a future date at the end of the loan term after 30 years, the amount will increase due to accruing of interest. Hence, we will calculate the future value of the balloon payment.

We can calculate the future value of the balloon payment by multiplying the balloon payment by the factor of the interest rate and period. Therefore we will use the following equation in our computation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Future Value of the Ballon payment} &= \text{BP}\times(1 + i)^t\
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$BP$, which refers to the balloon payment\
$i$, which indicates the interest rate\
$t$, which symbolizes the period

Let's now calculate the future value of the balloon payment.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Future Value of the Ballon payment} &= \$69,352.20\times\left(1 + \dfrac{0.0535}{12}\right)^{360}\
\\[10pt]
&= \$69,352.20\times 4.96 
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$343,996.22}
\end{aligned}$$

**Based on our calculation, the balloon payment to be paid at the end of the 30-year loan is $343,996.22.**

To conclude, the result of our calculation the balloon payment for the 30-year house loan is $343,996.22. We determined the balloon payment by deducting the present value of the loan from the cost of the house and calculating the future value of the balloon payment, considering the factor of the interest and the period of the loan.
